title: Former dairy farm in Dartmouth converted to $2M luxury home
author: Megan Johnson
bullets: A former dairy barn at 1 Masthead Lane, Dartmouth, was converted into a luxury home listed for $1,995,000.
The 7,891-square-foot property features four bedrooms, six bathrooms, and retains architectural elements from its dairy farm origins.
The home includes modern amenities such as a smart home system, solar panels, and a 12-car garage space.

title: Active-duty Boston police officer dies after more than 30 years with department, BPD says
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Boston Police Officer Scott MacIsaac died of cancer after more than 30 years of service.
MacIsaac, diagnosed in 2025, served in various districts and received multiple commendations during his career.
Funeral services will be held on February 5 at William J. Gormley Funeral Home and St. John Chrysostom Church.

title: Bruins’ Jeremy Swayman gets into goalie fight with Andrei Vasilevskiy in outdoor game
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jeremy Swayman and Andrei Vasilevskiy fought in front of 64,000 fans at Raymond James Stadium during the Stadium Series.
The fight between goalies occurred after tensions rose when Lightning forward Brandon Hagel tried to jam a puck in Swayman's pads.
Swayman and Vasilevskiy both received penalties but continued playing; Bruins lost 6-5 in a shootout game.

title: Suspect charged with murder after mother and son shot to death in Fall River
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Arlington Cole, 54, faces charges for the murder of Elizabeth Almeida, 54, and Nicholas Almedia, 25, in Fall River.
The shootings occurred on Barnes Street, and both victims died from gunshot wounds at a local hospital.
Cole, who was dating Elizabeth Almeida, was apprehended at the scene and scheduled for arraignment on Monday.

title: Dozens rescued by N.H. fire officials after ski lift malfunctions in bitter cold
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Nearly 60 skiers were rescued from a malfunctioning lift at the Dartmouth Skiway in Lyme Center, New Hampshire.
Fire and police officials from multiple departments evacuated 59 individuals in under an hour and a half.
One skier was treated at Dartmouth-Hitchcock Medical Center; others were checked and brought to the main lodge.

title: Former Mass. state senator receives more prison time for fraud
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Dean Tran, ex-Massachusetts state senator, received an additional 11-month federal prison sentence for obstruction of justice and lying to investigators.
Tran's new sentence mainly runs concurrently with his existing 18-month term for fraudulent pandemic unemployment assistance and tax offenses.
Tran's legal troubles include multiple charges at federal and state levels, involving ethics violations and a firearm theft from an elderly woman.

title: Bruins’ Fraser Minten named NHL Rookie of the Month
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Fraser Minten named NHL Rookie of the Month for January with eight goals and 14 points in 14 games.
Minten, acquired from the Maple Leafs, is first Bruins Rookie of the Month since Jeremy Swayman in 2022.
Bruins will rely on Minten in the Stadium Series against the Lightning with top centers injured.

title: 7 people are presumed dead after their Gloucester fishing boat sank. Here’s how they’ll be remembered.
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Seven crew members are presumed dead after the fishing boat Lily Jean sank off the Gloucester coast Friday morning.
The U.S. Coast Guard searched 1,000 square miles with no success and suspended search efforts after 24 hours.
Crew members included longtime local fishermen and a Fisheries Observer; investigations into the cause continue.

title: Bruins dress as colonial Patriots ahead of Stadium Series game in Tampa
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Bruins wore colonial-era patriot costumes for the Stadium Series game against Lightning in Tampa.
The costumes were designed by the local company Boston Costume, allowing players to add personal touches.
The Bruins matched their attire to historical themes for outdoor games, similar to past events like the 2019 Winter Classic.

title: Red Sox reportedly trade pitcher Jordan Hicks to White Sox
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Red Sox trade pitcher Jordan Hicks and prospect David Sandlin to White Sox for minor leaguer Gage Ziehl.
The trade involves the Red Sox sending cash to Chicago, with Hicks set to earn $12.5 million in 2026.
Hicks struggled in Boston with an 8.20 ERA in 2025 after being acquired in the Rafael Devers trade.
